pair.description: Conserved G-quadruplexes in 5' UTR, 3'UTR, and CDS. Gene is involved in cell division.
Conserved G-quadruplexes near translation start site. Defects in this gene can lead to infantile death.
Conserved G-quadruplexes in CDS. Gene involved in Parkinson's disease and dementia.
G-quadruplexes in the 5’UTR known to inhibit translation.
pair.ref: Lammich et. al., 2011. J. Biol. Chem.

pair.description: Regulatory G-quadruplexes in 5’UTR. Gene involved in tumorigenesis
pair.ref: Huang et. al., 2011. Nucl. Acids Res.

pair.description: Conserved G-quadruplexes in 5’- and 3’ UTRs of an oncogene
pair.ref: Kumari et. al., 2007. Nat. Chem Biol

pair.description: Conserved G-quadruplexes in the 5’-, 3-UTRs and CDS. Oncogene involved in neuroblastomas.
Conserved G-quadruplex in 3'UTR. Gene involved in morphogenesis.
Nucleolin binding sites (G-quadruplexes) in UTRs and CDS. Regulatory G-quadruplexes in 5’UTR of a transcription factor gene.
pair.ref: Abdelmohsen et. al., 2011. Nucl. Acids Res.

pair.description: Highly conserved and stable regulatory G-quadruplex in the 5’region of telomerase RNA component.
pair.ref: Lattmann et. al., 2011. Nucl. Acids Res.
